pr_title: [#1441] Make hard-coded event bus send timeout configurable.

timeline.bodyText: does it make sense to set this to 0?
timeline.author: sophokles73

replies.bodyText: Just I checked the implementation of DeliveryOptions.setSendTimeout(long timeout). They throw IllegalArgumentException, if the value is < 1 but its not documented in that method's javadoc. Anyway it cannot be set to 0. I will update it.
replies.author: kaniyan

replies.bodyText: My point is actually that IMHO it doesn't make sense to accept a very small value here, i.e. we should enforce a minimum value that makes some sense, e.g. 500ms?
replies.author: sophokles73

replies.bodyText: I see now what do you mean. But how do we conclude for such a minimum value?  Anyway we set a default value of 3000ms. DeliveryOptions.setSendTimeout(...) allows to set any timeout value greater than 0ms. IMHO why should we forbid this flexibility by setting a minimum value?
replies.author: kaniyan

replies.bodyText: Well, as I pointed out: because the system will not work if you set it to 1ms, will it?
replies.author: sophokles73

replies.bodyText:
Well, as I pointed out: because the system will not work if you set it to 1ms, will it?

Ok I see the point. The systems commonly we use are not yet so fast enough to set the value to 1 ms ;-). I will update it to a minimum value of 500ms.
replies.author: kaniyan

replies.bodyText: I have updated it with a minimum value of 500ms and pushed the changes. Would you mind taking a look?
replies.author: kaniyan

timeline.message:

 This timeout value is used when sending a message on the vert.x event bus.
